1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		cmdInfo.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description:	The Tcl module-info routine which provides informa-  **
14   |  **			tion about the state of Modules as the modulefile    **
15   |  **			is being parsed. 				     **
16   |  ** 									     **
17   |  **   Exports:		cmdModuleInfo					     **
18   |  ** 									     **
19   |  **   Notes:								     **
20   |  ** 									     **
21   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
22   |  ****/
23   | 
24   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
25   |  ** 									     **
26   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
27   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
28   |  ** 									     ** 
29   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/
30   | 
31   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: cmdInfo.c.src.html,v 1.9 2009/09/02 20:37:40 rkowen Exp $";
32   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
33   | 
34   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
35   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
36   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
37   | 
38   | #include "modules_def.h"
39   | 
40   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
41   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
42   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
43   | 
44   | /** not applicable **/
45   | 
46   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
47   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
48   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
49   | 
50   | /** not applicable **/
51   | 
52   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
53   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
54   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
55   | 
56   | /** not applicable **/
57   | 
58   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
59   | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
60   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
61   | 
62   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
63   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
64   | static	char	_proc_cmdModuleInfo[] = "cmdModuleInfo";
65   | #endif
66   | 
67   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
68   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
69   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
70   | 
71   | /** not applicable **/
72   | 
73   | 
74   | /*++++
75   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
76   |  ** 									     **
77   |  **   Function:		cmdModuleInfo					     **
78   |  ** 									     **
79   |  **   Description:	Callback function for 'module-info'		     **
80   |  ** 									     **
81   |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
82   |  ** 									     **
83   |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
84   |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
85   |  **			int		 argc		Number of arguments  **
86   |  **			char		*argv[]		Argument array	     **
87   |  ** 									     **
88   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
89   |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
90   |  ** 									     **
91   |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags			These are set up accordingly **
92   |  **						before this function is	     **
93   |  **						called in order to control   **
94   |  **						everything.		     **
95   |  **			g_specified_module	The module name from the     **
96   |  **						command line.		     **
97   |  **			g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
98   |  **						by the current command	     **
99   |  ** 									     **
100  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
101  |  ++++*/
102  | 
103  | int	cmdModuleInfo(	ClientData	 client_data,
104  | 	      		Tcl_Interp	*interp,
105  | 	      		int		 argc,
106  | 	      		CONST84 char	*argv[])
107  | {
108  |     char *s, *t, buf[ BUFSIZ];
109  | 
110  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
111  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_cmdModuleInfo, NULL);
112  | #endif
113  | 
114  |     /**
115  |      **  Parameter check
116  |      **/
117  | 
118  |     if( argc < 2) {
119  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_USAGE, LOC, argv[0], "info-descriptor ",
120  | 	    "descriptor-args", NULL))
121  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
122  |     }
123  |   
124  |     /**
125  |      **  'module-info flags' ?
126  |      **/
127  | 
128  |     if( !strcmp( argv[1], "flags")) {
129  |         char tmpbuf[6];
130  |         sprintf( tmpbuf, "%d", g_flags);
131  |         Tcl_SetResult( interp, tmpbuf, TCL_VOLATILE);
132  | 
133  |     /**
134  |      **  'module-info mode'
135  |      **  without suggestion this will return the name of the state we're in.
136  |      **/
137  | 
138  |     } else if( !strcmp( argv[1], "mode")) {
139  | 
140  |         if( argc < 3) {
141  |             if( g_flags & M_SWSTATE1)
142  |                 Tcl_SetResult( interp, "switch1", TCL_STATIC);
143  |             else if( g_flags & M_SWSTATE2)
144  |                 Tcl_SetResult( interp, "switch2", TCL_STATIC);
145  |             else if( g_flags & M_SWSTATE3)
146  |                 Tcl_SetResult( interp, "switch3", TCL_STATIC);
147  |             else if( g_flags & M_LOAD)
148  |                 Tcl_SetResult( interp, "load", TCL_STATIC);
149  |             else if( g_flags & M_REMOVE)
150  |                 Tcl_SetResult( interp, "remove", TCL_STATIC);
151  |             else if( g_flags & M_DISPLAY)
152  |                 Tcl_SetResult( interp, "display", TCL_STATIC);
153  |             else if( g_flags & M_HELP)
154  |                 Tcl_SetResult( interp, "help", TCL_STATIC);
155  |             else if( g_flags & M_WHATIS)
156  |                 Tcl_SetResult( interp, "whatis", TCL_STATIC);
157  |             else if( g_flags & M_NONPERSIST)
158  |                 Tcl_SetResult( interp, "nonpersist", TCL_STATIC);
159  |             else
160  |                 Tcl_SetResult( interp, "unknown", TCL_STATIC);
161  |             
162  |         } else {
163  |  
164  | 	    /**
165  | 	     **  'module-info mode <my_suggestion>'
166  | 	     **  results in a boolean return indicating whether this is the
167  | 	     **  correct state ...
168  | 	     **/
169  | 
170  | 	    Tcl_SetResult( interp, "0", TCL_STATIC);
171  | 
172  | 	    if( !strcmp( argv[2], "load")) {
173  | 		if( g_flags & M_LOAD) Tcl_SetResult( interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
174  | 	    }
175  | 	    else if( !strcmp( argv[2], "remove")) {
176  | 		if( g_flags & M_REMOVE) Tcl_SetResult( interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
177  | 	    }
178  | 	    else if( !strcmp( argv[2], "display")) {
179  | 		if( g_flags & M_DISPLAY) Tcl_SetResult( interp,"1", TCL_STATIC);
180  | 	    }
181  | 	    else if( !strcmp( argv[2], "nonpersist")) {
182  | 		if( g_flags & M_NONPERSIST) Tcl_SetResult( interp,"1", TCL_STATIC);
183  | 	    }
184  | 	    else if( !strcmp( argv[2], "help")) {
185  | 		if( g_flags & M_HELP) Tcl_SetResult( interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
186  | 	    }
187  | 	    else if( !strcmp( argv[2], "whatis")) {
188  | 		if( g_flags & M_WHATIS) Tcl_SetResult( interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
189  | 	    }
190  | 	    else if( !strcmp( argv[2], "switch1")) {
191  | 		if( g_flags & M_SWSTATE1) Tcl_SetResult( interp,"1",TCL_STATIC);
192  | 	    }
193  | 	    else if( !strcmp(argv[2], "switch2")) {
194  | 		if( g_flags & M_SWSTATE2) Tcl_SetResult( interp,"1",TCL_STATIC);
195  | 	    }
196  | 	    else if( !strcmp(argv[2], "switch3")) {
197  | 		if( g_flags & M_SWSTATE3) Tcl_SetResult( interp,"1",TCL_STATIC);
198  | 	    }
199  | 	    else if( !strcmp(argv[2], "switch")) {
200  | 		if( g_flags & M_SWITCH) Tcl_SetResult( interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
201  | 	    } else {
202  | 		ErrorLogger( ERR_USAGE, LOC, argv[0], "mode ", "[load|remove|"
203  | 		    "display|help|whatis|switch1|switch2|switch3|switch|nonpersist]", NULL);
204  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
205  | 	    }
206  | 	}
207  | 
208  |     /**
209  |      **  'module-info user'
210  |      **  without suggestion this will return the current user level
211  |      **/
212  | 
213  |     } else if( !strcmp( argv[1], "user")) {
214  | 
215  |         if( argc < 3) {
216  |             if( UL_NOVICE == sw_userlvl)
217  |                 Tcl_SetResult( interp, "novice", TCL_STATIC);
218  |             else if( UL_ADVANCED == sw_userlvl)
219  |                 Tcl_SetResult( interp, "advanced", TCL_STATIC);
220  |             else if( UL_EXPERT == sw_userlvl)
221  |                 Tcl_SetResult( interp, "expert", TCL_STATIC);
222  |             else
223  |                 Tcl_SetResult( interp, "unknown", TCL_STATIC);
224  |             
225  |         } else {
226  |  
227  | 	    /**
228  | 	     **  'module-info user <my_suggestion>'
229  | 	     **  results in a boolean return indicating whether this is the
230  | 	     **  correct user level ...
231  | 	     **/
232  | 
233  | 	    Tcl_SetResult( interp, "0", TCL_STATIC);
234  | 
235  | 	    if( !strcmp( argv[2], "novice")) {
236  | 		if( UL_NOVICE == sw_userlvl)
237  | 		    Tcl_SetResult( interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
238  | 	    }
239  | 	    else if( !strcmp( argv[2], "advanced")) {
240  | 		if( UL_ADVANCED == sw_userlvl)
241  | 		    Tcl_SetResult( interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
242  | 	    }
243  | 	    else if( !strcmp( argv[2], "expert")) {
244  | 		if( UL_EXPERT == sw_userlvl)
245  | 		    Tcl_SetResult( interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
246  | 	    } else {
247  | 		ErrorLogger( ERR_USAGE, LOC, argv[0], "user ",
248  | 		    "[novice|advanced|expert]", NULL);
249  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
250  | 	    }
251  | 	}
252  | 
253  |     /**
254  |      **  'module-info name'
255  |      **  returns the name of the current module
256  |      **/
257  | 
258  |     } else if( !strcmp(argv[1], "name")) {
259  |         Tcl_SetResult( interp, g_current_module, TCL_VOLATILE);
260  | 
261  |     /**
262  |      **  'module-info shell'
263  |      **  returns the name of the current user shell
264  |      **/
265  | 
266  |     } else if( !strcmp(argv[1], "shell")) {
267  |         if( argc < 3) {
268  | 	    Tcl_SetResult( interp, shell_name, TCL_VOLATILE);
269  |         } else {
270  | 	    if( !strcmp( argv[2], shell_name))
271  | 		Tcl_SetResult( interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
272  | 	    else
273  | 		Tcl_SetResult( interp, "0", TCL_STATIC);
274  | 	}
275  | 
276  |     } else if( !strcmp(argv[1], "shelltype")) {
277  |         if( argc < 3) {
278  | 	    Tcl_SetResult( interp, shell_derelict, TCL_VOLATILE);
279  |         } else {
280  | 	    if( !strcmp( argv[2], shell_derelict))
281  | 		Tcl_SetResult( interp, "1", TCL_STATIC);
282  | 	    else
283  | 		Tcl_SetResult( interp, "0", TCL_STATIC);
284  | 	}
285  | 
286  |     } else if( !strcmp(argv[1], "alias")) {
287  | 
288  | 	if( argc < 3) {
289  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_USAGE, LOC, argv[0], "alias ",
290  | 		"name", NULL))
291  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
292  | 	}
293  |       
294  | 	if( AliasLookup( (char *) argv[2], &s, &t)) {
295  | 	    /* sprintf( buf, "%s/%s", s, t); */
296  | 	    strcpy( buf, s);
297  | 	    strcat( buf, "/");
298  | 	    strcat( buf, t);
299  | 	    Tcl_SetResult( interp, buf, TCL_VOLATILE);
300  | 	} else {
301  | 	    Tcl_SetResult( interp, "*undef*", TCL_STATIC);
302  | 	}
303  | 
304  |     /**
305  |      **  'module-info symbols'
306  |      **  List all symbolic names of the passed or current module file
307  |      **/
308  | 
309  |     } else if( !strcmp(argv[1], "symbols")) {
310  | 	char *name;
311  | 
312  | 	name = (argc < 3) ? g_current_module : (char *) argv[2];
313  | 
314  | 	if((char *) NULL == (s = ExpandVersions( name)))
315  | 	    Tcl_SetResult( interp, "*undef*", TCL_STATIC);
316  | 	else
317  | 	    Tcl_SetResult( interp, (char *) s, TCL_VOLATILE);
318  | 
319  |     /**
320  |      **  'module-info version'
321  |      **  Returns the full qualified module name and version of the passed
322  |      **  symbolic version specifier
323  |      **/
324  | 
325  |     } else if( !strcmp(argv[1], "version")) {
326  | 	if( VersionLookup( (char *) argv[2], &s, &t)) {
327  | 	    if( t) {
328  | 		/* sprintf( buf, "%s/%s", s, t); */
329  | 		strcpy( buf, s);
330  | 		strcat( buf, "/");
331  | 		strcat( buf, t);
332  | 	    } else {
333  | 		/* sprintf( buf, "%s", s); */
334  | 		strcpy( buf, s);
335  | 	    }
336  | 	    Tcl_SetResult( interp, buf, TCL_VOLATILE);
337  | 	} else {
338  | 	    Tcl_SetResult( interp, "*undef*", TCL_STATIC);
339  | 	}
340  | 
341  |     /**
342  |      **  'module-info specified'
343  |      **   gives the module name as specified on the command line
344  |      **/
345  | 
346  |     } else if( !strcmp(argv[1], "specified")) {
347  | 	if( g_specified_module) {
348  | 	    /* TCL_STATIC because it comes from the command line */
349  | 	    Tcl_SetResult( interp, g_specified_module, TCL_STATIC);
350  | 	} else {
351  | 	    Tcl_SetResult( interp, "*undef*", TCL_STATIC);
352  | 	}
353  | 
354  |     /**
355  |      **  unknown command ....
356  |      **/
357  | 
358  |     } else {
359  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_INFO_DESCR, LOC, argv[1], NULL))
360  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
361  |     }
362  | 
363  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
364  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_cmdModuleInfo, NULL);
365  | #endif
366  | 
367  |     return( TCL_OK);
368  | 
369  | } /** End of 'cmdModuleInfo' **/
